sentences: Salvatore Licitra (10 August 1968 – 5 September 2011) was an Italian operatic tenor.
After 8 years of studies, initially as a choir vocalist, he left his voice teacher and enrolled at Carlo Bergonzi's voice academy in Busseto.
section: == Early life and debuts ==

sentences: He debuted in Un ballo in maschera in Parma in 1998, in a performance for Bergonzi's students.
section: == Early life and debuts ==

sentences: In March 1999, he debuted at La Scala under Riccardo Muti in La forza del destino as Alvaro, then sang in Tosca and Madama Butterfly at the Arena di Verona in June and July, then Tosca at La Scala in March 2000, again with Muti.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: In March 1999, he debuted at La Scala under Riccardo Muti in La forza del destino as Alvaro, then sang in Tosca and Madama Butterfly at the Arena di Verona in June and July, then Tosca at La Scala in March 2000, again with Muti.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: In March 1999, he debuted at La Scala under Riccardo Muti in La forza del destino as Alvaro, then sang in Tosca and Madama Butterfly at the Arena di Verona in June and July, then Tosca at La Scala in March 2000, again with Muti.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: In May he debuted in Madrid in La forza del destino, and in Verona, he was awarded the Premio Zenatello as tenor of the year, and sang in La forza del destino at the Arena in July.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: In May he debuted in Madrid in La forza del destino, and in Verona, he was awarded the Premio Zenatello as tenor of the year, and sang in La forza del destino at the Arena in July.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: In May he debuted in Madrid in La forza del destino, and in Verona, he was awarded the Premio Zenatello as tenor of the year, and sang in La forza del destino at the Arena in July.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: In September he traveled to Japan with the La Scala ensemble for performances of Forza.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: A performance of Il trovatore, recorded and issued by Sony, opened the 2000/2001 season at La Scala and the centennial of Verdi's death, the Anno Verdi.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: The opera had not been performed at La Scala in 22 years, and controversy ensued after Muti, who was the conductor and who had personally hand-picked Licitra for the role of Manrico, forbade his tenor to sing the traditional, interpolated high C of the 3rd act cabaletta "Di quella pira".
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: Six months later Licitra sang the part again in Verona to great acclaim.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: Prior to Il trovatore in Verona, he had performed in Un ballo in maschera at La Scala under Muti, then repeated the success in Rome in December.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: In November he made his American debut as a guest soloist at the 26th annual Richard Tucker Music Foundation Opera Gala in New York.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: In December he left for Vienna and the Wiener Staatsoper to sing in Tosca, then Manrico in Il trovatore at the Sao Carlos in Lisbon in January 2002 and Alvaro (Forza) in Turin in February.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: In December he left for Vienna and the Wiener Staatsoper to sing in Tosca, then Manrico in Il trovatore at the Sao Carlos in Lisbon in January 2002 and Alvaro (Forza) in Turin in February.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: In December he left for Vienna and the Wiener Staatsoper to sing in Tosca, then Manrico in Il trovatore at the Sao Carlos in Lisbon in January 2002 and Alvaro (Forza) in Turin in February.
section: == At La Scala and other houses ==

sentences: The Metropolitan Opera followed unexpectedly on 11 May 2002 when he appeared in Tosca, substituting for Luciano Pavarotti, then 66, who had cancelled the performance two hours before curtain time.
section: == The Met and beyond ==

sentences: The Metropolitan Opera followed unexpectedly on 11 May 2002 when he appeared in Tosca, substituting for Luciano Pavarotti, then 66, who had cancelled the performance two hours before curtain time.
section: == The Met and beyond ==

sentences: Licitra, who was not scheduled to debut there until 2004, was flown in by the Met as a back-up singer and eventually received a 43-second ovation at the conclusion of "Recondita armonia" and a 46-second ovation at the conclusion of "E lucevan le stelle".
section: == The Met and beyond ==

sentences: In the short time since his debut in 1998, Licitra was dubbed the New Pavarotti, a tenor "worthy of the great Italian tradition".
section: == The Met and beyond ==

sentences: Licitra's final public appearance was a concert performance of Puccini's Tosca with the Chicago Symphony Orchestra at the Ravinia Festival on 30 July 2011.
section: == The Met and beyond ==

sentences: On 27 August 2011, Licitra sustained severe head and chest injuries when he suffered a cerebral hemorrhage while riding his motor scooter and crashed into a wall in Donnalucata, Scicli, Ragusa Province, Sicily.
section: == Death ==

sentences: He remained in a coma for nine days in the Garibaldi Hospital in Catania and was pronounced dead on 5 September 2011.
section: == Death ==

sentences: He remained in a coma for nine days in the Garibaldi Hospital in Catania and was pronounced dead on 5 September 2011.
